results.title: Tomorrow's end. Episodes 7-12
results.brief_description: The final six half-hour episodes of “Tomorrow’s End” continue the story of brother and sister, Petey and Janey Kelly, and their futuristic adventures with the Girl from Tomorrow, Alana, to foil the evil Silverthorn and his plans to use Alana’s time capsule to alter history and destroy the world with nuclear weapons. In the end, the young trio triumph. Alana returns to her world and the Kellys to theirs, but they will never forget their travels together through time.

results.title: Feeling yes, feeling no. Parts 1, 2 and 3
results.creator_credit: Moira Simpson, Jennifer Torrance, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Feeling Yes, Feeling No Parts 1, 2 and 3 are part of a sexual - assault - prevention program for young children. The purpose of this video is to give children the skills necessary to protect themselves from sexual assault - from strangers, from family members, from other trusted persons. Part 1 teaches children basic skills that build self-worth, self-confidence and good judgment. Part 2 reinforces the understanding of “Yes” feelings and “No” feelings and introduces skills to keep children assess potentially dangerous situations involving strangers. Part 3, introduces the issue of sexual assault by a trusted adult.

results.title: The Comancheros (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, George Sherman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A member of the legendary Texas Rangers works undercover to foil a notorious gang of outlaws in this top-notch Western. John Wayne stars as the two-fisted Ranger heading a cast that includes Stuart Whitman and Lee Marvin. The last film directed by Michael Curtiz “The Comancheros” is a lively, riotous Western with some exciting action sequences. Based on the novel by Paul I. Wellman.

results.title: The Undefeated (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Andrew V McLaglen, Robert L. Jacks and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Two former colonels, one Confederate, the other Union, find themselves in Mexico after the Civil War. Unlikely allies, the two are forced to team up to fight Juarez’ ruthless banditos as well as the Emperor Maximilian’s rampaging army in this epic Western adventure. Starring John Wayne and Rock Hudson.

results.title: To be or not to be (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alan Johnson, Mel Brooks, Brooksfilms and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Mel Brooks’ hilarious remake of the Lubitsch comedy classic about a Polish theatre troupe which gets caught up in Hitler’s invasion of Poland. Brooks and Anne Bancroft play the lead actors in the troupe who are forever trying to gain the limelight from each other. When they become involved in a wild plot to threaten the Nazis, their battles become even more comic. The great cast includes Tim Matheson, Jose Ferrer and Charles Durning.

results.title: Some like it hot (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Two jazz musicians (played brilliantly by Jack Lemmon and Tony Curtis) witness the St. Valentine’s Day Massacre and elude their gangster pursuers by disguising themselves as women and joining an all-girl band headed for Miami. Billy Wilder and I.A.L. Diamond had no doubts that they were making the funniest film of their careers when they created this superb comedy. Marilyn Monroe plays a singer in one of her best performances ever.

results.title: Bonnie and Clyde (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Arthur Penn, Warren Beatty and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Alternating between comedy and tragedy this violent and kinetic re-telling of the story of Bonnie and Clyde is justifiably one of the most celebrated American films of the sixties. Set in the early thirties of the Depression, a car thief and his girl-friend commit a series of robberies which earn them a reputation as America’s most feared criminals. Featuring superb production values and brilliant editing, Arthur Penn’s film is an ironic exploration of the romantic roots of the counter-culture in the myths and memories of the Depression and within Hollywood depictions of the “outlaw”. The film’s controversial use of violence is simultaneously brutal and liberating. With Warren Beatty, Faye Dunaway and Gene Hackman.

results.title: The Charm of Britain
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: Britain in the 1990’s is in a period of transition. There’s division about the future of the Royal Family and doubts about the country’s closer links with Europe. Many in Scotland would like to become independent. The Welsh also want greater autonomy in running their own affairs. But through it all, the British remain British - and custodians of one of the most beautiful islands on earth. Less than a thousand kilometres long from top to bottom, and home to almost 60 million people, Great Britain may not be the world power it once was, but in terms of history and culture, it still has few equals. Our intention is to travel the length of this amazingly diverse country, observing the growing independence of many of its regions, sampling its rich traditions, as we discover for ourselves “The Charm of Britain”.

results.title: Homophobia in Hollywood
results.creator_credit: Clare Beavan, Shauna Brown and Channel Four
results.brief_description: In 1992 the release of “Basic Instinct” and “The Silence of the Lambs” resulted in gay and lesbian activists organising nation-wide protests against Hollywood’s portrayal of gay characters in films. “Homophobia in Hollywood” features interviews with director Paul Verhoeven (Basic Instinct), screen- writer Ted Tally (Silence of the Lambs) and producer Howard Rosenman (Father of the Bride) who discuss their reaction to gay and lesbian critics of their work. Gay director Tom Kalin (Swoon) discusses some of the difficulties he has with notions of “positive” and “negative” representation. This video is a revealing insight into the conservative attitudes and artistic bankruptcy of the Hollywood entertainment community.

results.title: The Smell of war
results.creator_credit: Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: A segment from the television program “History in action”, this video is aimed at an audience of junior high school students through to adults. It is an investigation of the conditions and events leading to the spark that set off World War I. Includes rare archival footage.
